feeling.translation[0].definitions[0].de: an emotion that you feel, such as anger, sadness, or happiness
feeling.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Knowing we'd won was a wonderful feeling.
feeling.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a belief or opinion about something, especially one that is influenced by your emotions
feeling.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: My personal feeling is that not enough has been done.
His gut feeling  (=opinion based on emotion) was that Burns was probably guilty.
I had this funny feeling (=not easily explained) that something was wrong.
She has strong feelings on the issue of abortion.
a survey on people’s feelings about the candidates
feeling.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a general attitude among a group of people about a subject
feeling.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: the anti-American feeling in the region
Johnson underestimated the strength of public feeling against the war.
the depth of feeling against nuclear weapons
feeling.translation[0].definitions[3].de: something that you feel in your body, such as heat, cold, tiredness etc
feeling.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: I keep getting this funny feeling  (=a strange feeling) in my neck.
feeling.translation[0].definitions[4].de: the ability to feel pain, heat etc in part of your body
feeling.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Harry had lost all feeling in his toes.
feeling.translation[0].definitions[5].de: the effect that a place, book, film etc has on people and the way it makes them feel
feeling.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: It gives a feeling of eating outdoors, without having to worry about being rained on.
the town’s strong feeling of history
feeling.translation[0].definitions[6].de: a way of reacting to things using your emotions, instead of thinking about them carefully
feeling.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: The Romantic writers valued feeling above all else.
feeling.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: a good/great/wonderful etc feeling
It's a great feeling when you try something new and it works.
A deep feeling of sadness came over her.
strong/intense
There was a strong feeling of anger among the workers.
experience a feeling
I remember experiencing a feeling of tremendous excitement.
give somebody a feeling
My work gives me a feeling of achievement.
arouse a feeling
The music aroused a feeling of calm within him.
hurt somebody's feelings
I hope I didn't hurt your feelings.
hide your feelings
She could no longer hide her feelings.
show your feelings
I know you find it embarrassing to show your feelings.
express your feelings
Children sometimes find it difficult to put their feelings into words.
have mixed feelings
Her parents had mixed feelings about the marriage.
feelings are running high
It was the last game of the season, and feelings were running high.
